div.div:
fix: resolve CSS conflicts affecting Boltzmann equation display styling
- Scope calculator-specific .equation-container styles to #efficiency-calculator - Scope applications impact .equation-container styles to #applications-impact - Prevent CSS conflicts between new calculator features and existing scientific display sections - Restore proper blue background styling for Boltzmann equation showcase section - Maintain complete style isolation between different page sections
This resolves the styling issue where new calculator CSS was overriding the scientific breakthrough section's equation display appearance.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

refactor: remove unused countdown timer functionality
- Remove countdown-timer.js file completely as it is no longer used - Remove script tag reference from index.html - Remove countdown-related CSS styles and animations from styles.css - Clean up .countdown-item, @keyframes countdownPulse, and responsive countdown styles - Website continues to function normally without countdown functionality
Resolves cleanup of unused countdown timer components
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

feat(accessibility): enhance form ARIA labeling and detection
- Add methods to automatically enhance form accessibility by generating and applying appropriate ARIA labels, descriptions, and required indicators for form fields lacking proper labeling, and improve support for placeholder text and contextual label detection.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

fix: resolve powerDensity.toFixed TypeError in efficiency calculator
Fix TypeError advanced.powerDensity?.toFixed is not a function by correcting property access pattern in efficiency-calculator.js line 440. The powerDensity object contains a nested powerDensity property, requiring double property access for the numeric value.
- Change powerDensity?.toFixed to powerDensity?.powerDensity?.toFixed - Ensures proper access to numeric value for toFixed() method - Maintains safe optional chaining for error prevention - Calculator now works without JavaScript errors
Resolves issue #37
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

style(js): remove extra blank lines to improve code readability
- This commit only changes whitespace, specifically replacing blank lines within some functions, but does not affect the logic, functionality, or output of the code. - Only extra blank lines or whitespace were changed in the file, with no functional modification to the code.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

feat: redesign complete scientific principles section with enhanced formula display
- Restructure formula layout with larger, more spacious cards using improved grid system - Add colorful gradient backgrounds and icons for different formula categories - Enhance equation containers with better spacing (min-h-80px) and responsive design - Implement advanced hover effects with transform animations and shadow enhancements - Upgrade ion system performance analysis with detailed comparison data - Add comprehensive responsive design support for mobile, tablet, and desktop - Improve visual hierarchy with proper color coding for different equation types - Ensure proper MathJax rendering with enhanced styling and interaction effects
Resolves formula display issues shown in user feedback images
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

feat: integrate MathJax with educational content in efficiency calculator
- Fix global variable naming inconsistency (window.MathRenderer vs window.mathRenderer) - Update MathRenderer initialization to properly set global instance reference - Add retry mechanism for delayed initialization scenarios - Resolve 'MathRenderer not available for educational content' warnings - Enable formula rendering in educational modal sections (basic concepts, technical principles, applications) - Implement educational equation definitions for thermodynamic efficiency, gravity ion effects, and power density calculations
Resolves #37
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>
